Job Title: Director of Preconstruction

Location: Kansas City Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Project Management, Sales, Strategy/Planning

Description:
For over 125 years A. Zahner Company has pioneered advances in the architectural metal industry, by developing and applying the science of metal fabrication and cutting-edge engineering technologies. Zahner is known throughout the world for precision craftsmanship in the production of designs by bold architects. Zahner is a rapidly growing company with excellent potential for career development in a variety of engineering fields. High profile projects include SOFI Stadium, Kaufmann Performing Arts Center, Peterson Auto Museum, EMP Museum, and many more (https://www.azahner.com/works/)
General ResponsibilityBeing the liaison between Sales and Operations, the Director of Pre-Construction leads Estimating, Contracts, Sales Engineering, and Pre-Construction Project Management functions within Zahner. The primary purpose of the Pre-Construction team is to establish a clear scope, budget, quality, and schedule baseline through early design collaborationand risk planning with the sales team and our clients, which enables a clean and efficient transfer to the post-contract project management team.
Primary ResponsibilitiesLead Pre-Construction TeamLead Preconstruction Team to Ensure Resources are working in concert with the companies’ goals and objectives.Maintain historical references for costs, categories, margins, etc.Ensure continuity between sales and operations for business strategies, lessons learned and historical content.Contract Review and Management for External contracts (both Zahner standard terms and Project Specific Contracts)
Support SalesSupport Sales through the estimating and sales engineering process.Work with Sales to implement strategies for the business to continue to win work and maintain a proper backlog.Collaborate with sales to ensure we have enough definition of projects to perform estimates.Collaborate with sales to ensure operations are aware of upcoming trends, business headwinds etc.
Support OperationsManage and Perform Design Assist work.Provide consistent handoff documents and requirements for each project.Collaborate with Sales and Operations to ensure we have a defined project scope, schedule, budget and quality expectations before signing contracts.Collaborate with Operations to ensure they are aware of upcoming work, business trends, headwinds etc.
Support Continuous Improvement of Operations
Qualifications, Education Requirements, ExperienceBachelor’s Degree in Construction Management, Construction Science or equivalent from an accredited college or university (or equivalent experience). Minimum 6 years of professional experience in a construction setting.Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in a manufacturing setting.Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in the role of project management.Proficient in Microsoft Office products.Proficient in industry standard estimating, forecasting and scheduling techniques and software.Team attitude oriented toward making others successful.Able to multi-task and handle multiple unique projects.Fundamental knowledge of contract law and project accounting.Thorough working knowledge and understanding of all project management control systems (scheduling, estimating, cost control, procurement, and business development).
Work Environment, Physical Demands, Travel RequirementsThe physical demands represent requirements to perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations to perform the essential functions may be available.Majority of time is spent performing essential functions around a desk/table arrangement while occasionally moving to other locations for meetings, discussions, or observation.Must enter and interpret computer data, read, and file documents with small letters/numbers/symbols on documents and electronic devices. Moves devices/tools, pushes, and pulls, weighing less than 25 pounds.Lifting or raising small objects from the ground to a tabletop, occasionally lifting overhead.Travel by airplane and/or personal vehicle to and from other office locations is less than 5%.

Experience Level (if available): Director
